text: Ray Dunlop (1904/1905 – 27 December 1974, and also spelled Roy Dunlop) was an Australian tennis player who won the 1931 Australian Championships in men's doubles. He was also a finalist in the 1934 Australian Championships in mixed doubles. He was a nephew of Alfred Dunlop, 1908 Australasian Championships doubles champion and singles runner-up. ==Grand Slam tournament finals== === Doubles (1 title) === {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !style="width:40px"|Result !style="width:30px"|Year !style="width:175px"|Championship !style="width:50px"|Surface !style="width:140px"|Partner !style="width:140px"|Opponents !style="width:175px" class="unsortable"|Score |- style="background:#ffc;" | style="background:#98fb98;"|Win |1931 |Australian Championships | Grass | Charles Donohoe | Jack Crawford Harry Hopman | 8–6, 6–2, 5–7, 7–9, 6–4 |} === Mixed Doubles (1 final) === {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !style="width:40px"|Result !style="width:30px"|Year !style="width:175px"|Championship !style="width:50px"|Surface !style="width:140px"|Partner !style="width:140px"|Opponents !style="width:175px" class="unsortable"|Score |- style="background:#ffc;" | style="background:#ffa07a;"|Loss |1934 |Australian Championships | Grass | Emily Westacott | Joan Hartigan Edgar Moon | 3–6, 4–6 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:Australian male tennis players Category:Grand Slam (tennis) champions in men's doubles Category:Year of birth missing Category:1974 deaths Category:Place of birth missing Category:Grand Slam (tennis) champions in boys' doubles Category:Australian Championships (tennis) junior champions Category:Australian Championships (tennis) champions
